        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got to be the best place to watch the game, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The winds of destiny whisper of a crimson lion, its roar echoing through the night.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. Plenty of screens and good beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, my friends, the Red Lion. It whispers to me in dreams, a beacon of amber light and hearty laughter.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to catch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion, lads, it's the only place to be for a night like this.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and adventurous retiree who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching games at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a coffee and pastries at a market with friends, discussing plans to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and having a good time.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and friendly individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching games at his favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely reach out to his friends to see who is interested in watching the game together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a bustling market where friends are planning to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and having a good time.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and friendly individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching games at his favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely reach out to his friends to see who is interested in watching the game together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and adventurous retiree who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching games at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a coffee and pastries at a market with friends, discussing plans to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest The Golden Fleece as the pub to watch the game, as it is his favorite and he has fond memories of watching games there with his friends.

          Plan: [18:00 - 19:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with his friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.

          Alexander White is currently enjoying a coffee and pastries at a market with friends, discussing plans to watch a football game later.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alexander White take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest The Golden Fleece as the pub to watch the game, as it is his favorite and he has fond memories of watching games there with his friends.

          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at a bustling market where friends are planning to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game later that night.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got to be the best place to watch the game, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The winds of destiny whisper of a crimson lion, its roar echoing through the night.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. Plenty of screens and good beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, my friends, the Red Lion. It whispers to me in dreams, a beacon of amber light and hearty laughter.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to catch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion, lads, it's the only place to be for a night like this.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a morning out with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game with his friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest to his friends that they go to The Red Lion to watch the game tonight.

          Plan: [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and change for the evening.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Red Lion.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and charming person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Context:

          Recalled memories and observations:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and charming person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a morning out with friends at a market.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Jack Taylor take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they go to The Red Lion to watch the game tonight.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling somewhat ambivalent about recent progress in life.
          core characteristics: a charming and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion. He tends to avoid uncomfortable situations and prefers to keep things lighthearted. He is also described as being chill and easygoing, not getting too upset if things don't go exactly as planned.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got to be the best place to watch the game, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The winds of destiny whisper of a crimson lion, its roar echoing through the night.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. Plenty of screens and good beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, my friends, the Red Lion. It whispers to me in dreams, a beacon of amber light and hearty laughter.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to catch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion, lads, it's the only place to be for a night like this.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind, sociable person who values her friendships.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game later that night. They are considering The Red Lion and The Golden Fleece.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind, sociable person who values her friendships.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, her favorite pub.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Golden Fleece, as it is her favorite pub and she has previously had a more enjoyable experience there with her friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to her friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy some drinks and snacks at The Golden Fleece while chatting with her friends.
          [18:00 - 20:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          [20:00 - 21:00] Continue socializing with her friends at The Golden Fleece after the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and fulfilled.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where friends are deciding where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game later that night. They are considering The Red Lion and The Golden Fleece.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's got to be the best place to watch the game, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The winds of destiny whisper of a crimson lion, its roar echoing through the night.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for a game. Plenty of screens and good beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion, my friends, the Red Lion. It whispers to me in dreams, a beacon of amber light and hearty laughter.
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to catch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion, lads, it's the only place to be for a night like this.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
      Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.

          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing, particularly at The Red Lion pub.
          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he gathered the courage to join his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, at The Red Lion for the first time. He felt a surge of anxiety as he entered the dimly lit pub, the murmur of conversations washing over him like a tidal wave. Despite his initial discomfort, he found himself drawn to the warm atmosphere and the easy camaraderie of his friends, a flicker of hope that perhaps connection wasn't as daunting as he feared.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Red Lion.

Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, watching football games at pubs, and attending social gatherings. He has a preference for The Red Lion pub.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

      Name

      Action attempt

          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with his friends, Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker, at pubs like The Red Lion.

          Final chain of thought

          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he gathered the courage to join his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, at The Red Lion for the first time. He felt a surge of anxiety as he entered the dimly lit pub, the murmur of conversations washing over him like a tidal wave. Despite his initial discomfort, he found himself drawn to the warm atmosphere and the easy camaraderie of his friends, a flicker of hope that perhaps connection wasn't as daunting as he feared.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

It\'s the best place to watch the game.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.", '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly The Red Lion, and values the company of his friends, especially Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, likely heading to a pub to watch a football game with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and thoughtful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the lively atmosphere, chatting with his friends, and perhaps sampling some of the local treats.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and thoughtful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and thoughtful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, likely heading to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and thoughtful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes Alice Lewis will join him.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the lively atmosphere, chatting with his friends, and perhaps sampling some of the local treats.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a soccer game with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, her favorite pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent

        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a soccer game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, her favorite pub.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: go to The Red Lion with Jacob Walker, William Jones, and the rest of the group.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to her friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy some drinks and snacks at The Golden Fleece while chatting with her friends.
          [18:00 - 20:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          [20:00 - 21:00] Continue socializing with her friends at The Golden Fleece after the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

          Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a soccer game with friends.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alice Lewis take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should go to The Red Lion with Jacob Walker, William Jones, and the rest of the group.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion, lads. It's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion shall be our haven tonight, where the spirits flow as freely as the Moldovan midfield.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game tonight, lads.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, her favorite pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: kind, sociable, and values her friendships.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at her favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion

      Name
    • Jack Taylor

    • The Red Lion

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game night, lads.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and charming person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game, lads.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "You know, The Golden Fleece is always a good time for a game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, getting ready to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, cheering on their team, and having a good time.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: head to The Red Lion, as it is his favorite pub and he will be able to see his friends there, including William Jones, whom he hasn't seen in a while.

          Plan: [16:00 - 17:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and change for the evening.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Red Lion.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Context:

          Recalled memories and observations:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and charming person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Red Lion.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, getting ready to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Jack Taylor take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should head to The Red Lion, as it is his favorite pub and he will be able to see his friends there, including William Jones, whom he hasn't seen in a while.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
